definition: to play tricks on sb
surname Shua
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
surname Hua
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: You see, Jane, you cannot try your tricks on Mr Brocklehurst.
sentences.chinese: 你不能在布魯克赫斯特先生那兒耍花招。

sentences.english: Don't try to cheat on your income tax, or you could get into hot water .
sentences.chinese: 不要在所得稅上耍花招，否則你會有麻煩。

sentences.english: Lest I should know you too easily, you play with me.
sentences.chinese: 只恐我太輕易地認得你，你對我耍花招。

sentences.english: He is up to his tricks again.
That was a contemptible trick to play on a friend.
sentences.chinese: 對朋友耍花招是卑鄙的。

sentences.english: The criminal outwitted the police and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 那罪犯耍花招瞞過了警察，逃跑了。

sentences.english: Recent college graduates who go into banking.
sentences.chinese: 應屆畢業生總是愛在學校大耍花招。

sentences.english: He's as snaky as a fox.
sentences.chinese: 他像狐狸一樣還耍花招。

sentences.english: The thief outwitted the police and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 小偷耍花招瞞過警察跑掉了。

sentences.english: 'Come now, don't try any clever tricks with me! What's your name?'he demanded.
sentences.chinese: 過來，別跟我耍花招，你叫什麼名字？

sentences.english: Instead, the attempt to appease government concerns was perceived as a ploy.
sentences.chinese: 華爲此舉本欲安撫美國政府，但卻被認爲是在耍花招。

definition: to play tricks on sb
to play tricks
see 耍滑[shua3 hua2]
to play dumb/to slack off (idiom)
to act stupid/to play dumb/to pretend to not know
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
trick/maneuver/razzle-dazzle/(martial arts) fancy move/flourish
to defraud/to rig up (a scam)
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to play tricks/to dupe
to think oneself clever (idiom)
to refuse a toast only to be forced to drink a forfeit/fig. to hesitate to do sth until forced to do even more
pinyin: jing4 jiu3 bu4 chi1 chi1 fa2 jiu3

definition: to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
to play with/to engage in/to resort to/to dally with
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
lit. dress up as God, play the devil (idiom); fig. to mystify/to deceive people/to scam
